item.title: Bin has been in pathway abandoned for over a year, 18th December
item.description:
This bin is always on the public pathway outside number 104, and causes a dangerous obstacle next to the neighbouring primary school. This has been reported numerous times including REF 8553245 as the latest, with no resolution. It needs to be removed please, it has been months.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwood Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All along richmer road and Slade Green road there is litter, 18th December
item.description:
There is litter all along richmer road between the pavement and the industrial building. This goes all along richmer road and also continues onto Slade Green Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Richmer Road, Slade Green, Greater London

item.title: Pavement in unfit state, 18th December
item.description:
Sheets of plywood on pavement outside number 38 is both a trip and slip hazard (in the rain). Need to be removed. Pavement has been left by builders in a substandard condition.

item.title: There is a hole in the inspection cover approximately 400mm x 200mm which is a risk to pedestrians., 18th December
item.description:
The Biffa lorry was parked on the footway. I told the driver he had damaged the footway. The vehicle registration of the Biffa lorry was KU68 BWF. I suggest contacting Biffa and asking them to pay for the costs to repair the damages footway and ask them to tell all their drivers not to drive or park on footways

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 167, Main Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on outside lane, 18th December
item.description:
There is a large pothole on the outside lane travelling from Barnet towards Muswell Hill. It is over 50cm wide and at least 20cm deep and you have to swerve to avoid it whilst driving. It has been there for about 3 weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colney Hatch Lane, Colney Hatch, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous deep potholes and road debris from the potholes, 18th December
item.description:
There are numerous potholes along this stretch of road that are at least 10cm deep and over 50cm across including one with a significant amount of road debris from the broken tarmac. They have been there for several months now. You have just closed the road for 2 weeks to put in speed cushions yet didn't think to actually resurface the road first! Did the contractors not think to report the fact that the road needed resurfacing and correct it?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Friary Road, North Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 18th December
item.description:
At 16:58 on 18/12/2025, an occupant (female, dark hair tied back, wearing sweater top & joggers bottoms) of 22 Draycott Avenue, was banging a black plastic bin onto the pavement & rubbish fell out onto the pavement. The same woman went into the rear of 22 Draycott Avenue to fetch a broom that she used to sweep the rubbish into the edge of the road & pavement & returned to the rear of 22 Draycott Avenue using the alleyway. That back alleyway (that runs along the back of numbers 18 to 24 Draycott Avenue) is used by some of those occupants to take rubbish out, usually for collecting by refuse collectors NOT to dump rubbish as the described woman did. It is unacceptable for health, safety & environmental reasons to dump rubbish out onto the public highways.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rosemoor Street, Chelsea, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 18th December
item.description:
A utility company previously dug up the road and the council carried out some patchwork repairs on previous potholes. All of this work was carried out to a low standard causing more potholes in between the patchwork of repairs and poor utility work. Combined with increased traffic from Thames Water closing Bromley Common frequently potholes are occurring.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mosslea Road, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
